Extended model summary

info.Rd

Extended summary information for model fits. Currently linear and logistic regression models are supported.

info(x)

Arguments

x

an object of type lm or glm. If glm, then family must be binomial.

Value

A list produced by info.lm or info.glm.

Details

info is a generic S3 function providing detailed model information. The goal is to provide more extensive information than currently produced by summary. See the related methods for details.

See also

info.lm, info.glm.

Examples

# multiple regression
fit <- lm(mpg ~ hp + wt + accel + origin, data = auto_mpg)
info(fit)
#> MULTIPLE REGRESSION SUMMARY 
#> Model: mpg ~ hp + wt + accel + origin
#> Data : auto_mpg
#> N    : 392
#> 
#> Fit Indices 
#>  R.Squared Adj.R.Squared  AIC RMSE  MAE
#>      0.719         0.716 2238 4.13 3.15
#> 
#> Omnibus Test 
#> F(5,386) = 197.852, p < <2e-16  *** 
#> 
#> Anova Table (type III tests) 
#>               Sum Sq  DF F value Pr(>F)    
#> (Intercept) 5473.655   1 316.038 <0.001 ***
#> hp           220.431   1  12.727 <0.001 ***
#> wt          1017.753   1  58.763 <0.001 ***
#> accel          1.117   1   0.065    0.8    
#> origin       308.474   2   8.905 <0.001 ***
#> Residuals   6685.366 386                   
#> 
#> Regression Coefficients 
#>                    B      B*       SE      t Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept) 43.29141  0.0000 2.435185 17.777 4.41e-52 ***
#> hp          -0.05643 -0.2783 0.015818 -3.568 4.06e-04 ***
#> wt          -0.00477 -0.5188 0.000622 -7.666 1.46e-13 ***
#> accel       -0.03085 -0.0109 0.121477 -0.254 8.00e-01    
#> origin2      0.97656  0.0474 0.643910  1.517 1.30e-01    
#> origin3      2.75244  0.1416 0.653731  4.210 3.18e-05 ***

# logistic regression
mtcars$am <- factor(mtcars$am)
fit2 <- glm(am ~ hp + wt + mpg, family=binomial, mtcars)
info(fit2)
#> LOGISTIC REGRESSION SUMMARY 
#> Formula: am ~ hp + wt + mpg
#> Data   : mtcars
#> N      : 32
#> 
#> Predicted category: 1
#> 
#> Omnibus Test 
#> Chi-square(3) = 34.4636, p = 1.581e-07 ***
#> 
#> Fit Measures 
#> Stukel's GOF Test: Chi-square(2) = 8.7661, p < 0.0125
#> Tjura's Psuedo-R.squared: 0.8216
#> AIC: 16.7661 
#> 
#> Anova Table (type III tests) 
#>     LR Chisq DF Pr(>Chisq)   
#> hp     8.418  1   0.003715 **
#> wt    10.466  1   0.001216 **
#> mpg    1.293  1   0.255496   
#> 
#> Logistic Regression Coefficients 
#>                     B       SE       z Pr(>|z|)  
#> (Intercept) -15.72137 40.00281 -0.3930  0.69431  
#> hp            0.08389  0.08228  1.0196  0.30790  
#> wt           -6.95492  3.35297 -2.0743  0.03806 *
#> mpg           1.22930  1.58109  0.7775  0.43686  
#> 
#> Odds Ratios (with 95% Confidence Intervals) 
#>     Odds Ratio      2.5%     97.5%
#> hp   1.0875130 1.014e+00    1.5532
#> wt   0.0009539 1.002e-08    0.1163
#> mpg  3.4188427 6.195e-01 1710.0900
